tn.text: Many verses in Chapter 10 are contrasting parallelisms (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
After the introduction of Chapters 1-9, Chapter 10 begins the collection of the proverbs; short sayings that teach wisdom.
acquired over time

tn.ref: Yahweh does not let the soul of the righteous person go hungry
tn.text: Here "soul" refers to the person. This can be stated in positive form. AT: "Yahweh makes sure those who do what is right have food to eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
"Hand" represents the strength and ability of a person. AT: "A person unwilling to work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Hand" represents the strength and ability of a person. AT: "person who works hard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"head" represents the whole person. AT: "are given to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "words the wicked speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
hides the truth
"name" represents a person's reputation. AT: "memory" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"be destroyed" or "be made useless"
not straight; deformed; dishonest; deceitful
"Winking the eye" represents a secretive sign for being cruel to someone else. AT: "He who makes a signal with a gesture" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A person who is ruined is spoken of as if he were thrown down. AT: "others will ruin him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"The words of a righteous person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: is a water spring of life
tn.text: This person's speech is spoken of as if it preserved living animals or people, as a water spring would do in a dry land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"Mouth" represents what a persons says. AT: "the words of a wicked person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the mouth of the wicked covers up violence
tn.text: That is, the wicked person appears to say harmless things, but plans to violent things against other people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Love acts like a person who quiets trouble between people instead of stirring it up. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: on the lips of a discerning person
tn.text: "Lips" represents what a person says. AT: "in what a sensible person says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: a rod is for the back
tn.text: "Rod" represents strong, physical punishment and "the back" represents the person who receives the punishment. AT: "a person who has no sense needs forceful punishment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "the words from a foolish person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This represents wealth as a safe place. AT: "his safety" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These terms normally refer to the money a worker earns. Here they represents the results of either doing what is right or doing what is wrong. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: There is a path to life for the one who follows discipline
tn.text: "The person who obeys wise instruction will have a long and happy life"

tn.ref: but the one who rejects correction is led astray
tn.text: "but the one who does not obey wise instruction will not have a good life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"Lips" represent what a person says. AT: "tells lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"there is much sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: The tongue of the righteous person
tn.text: "Tongue" represents what a person says. AT: "Whatever a righteous person says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Silver" represents valuable sayings. AT: "is extremely valuable" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"Lips" represents what a person says. AT: "The sayings of a righteous man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
cause them to develop or grow stronger

tn.ref: Wickedness is a game a fool plays
tn.text: A game is an activity people do for pleasure. AT: "Fools find pleasure in wickedness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
overcome someone

tn.ref: The wicked are like the storm
tn.text: Just as storm comes and sweeps everything away so wicked people will disappear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: is a foundation that lasts forever
tn.text: "Foundation" represents the base or a beginning of something that people build over. AT: "is a start for something that lasts forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Like vinegar on the teeth and smoke in the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him
tn.text: "Vinegar" and "smoke" represent things that hurt a person's teeth and eyes. AT: "Sending a lazy person to accomplish a task is irritating and unpleasant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a sour liquid used to flavor or preserve foods
"Years" represent the time a person lives. AT: "the lifetime of the evil person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "years" represent the time a person lives. AT: "the lifetime of the evil person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated as active and positive: AT: "will be secure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Out of the mouth of the righteous person
tn.text: "Mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "From the righteous man's words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the perverse tongue will be cut out
tn.text: "Tongue" represents what a person says. AT: "God will shut the mouths of people who say what is false" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: lips of the righteous know what is acceptable
tn.text: "Lips" represent what a person says. AT: "righteous person knows how to speak acceptably" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "the words of the wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
